item.title: Self Driving Car (SeDriCa)
item.description:
I was a part of Team SeDriCa consisting of around 20 members. We were one of the 11 finalists among 289 teams competing in the Mahindra RISE Driverless Car Challenge to build India's first self driving car targeting the level 5 autonomy and received a Mahindra E2O for development of the same.

In my initial months, I was mainly understanding and implementing models in the computer vision subsytem, training Traffic Sign and Traffic Light classifier based on Resnet-50 and Resnet-152 architectures.

I, then switched to handle Path Planning and Decision Making subsytem as CV modules were giving decent results. I went for on-ground testing of the vehicle (in the campus) and optimized the path of the vehicle accounting for the location and information of obstacles and traffic signals using Robot Operating System (ROS).

One of my major contribution in this subsytem was implementing RRT* algorithm and integrating with other modules through ROS, to improve the speed and accuracy of finding path which was previously using Hybrid-A*.

Our self driving car intro and in news here
